solution.text:
Distance covered by the car\(=speed\times time\)
Distance\(=_{j}_\times _{k}_ \,km\,=_{{j*k}}_\times 1000\, metres\)
Perimeter of the wheel is\(=\pi \times D=\frac {22}7 \times _{{Decimal('0.1')*j}}_=_{{trunc(pi_val*Decimal('0.1')*j,2)}}_\)metres
\(Distance=revolution\times perimeter\)
\(\Rightarrow revolutions=\frac {_{{j*k*1000}}_}{_{{trunc(pi_val*Decimal('0.1')*j,2)}}_}\)
Revolutions=\(_{{trunc((j*k*1000)/(pi_val*Decimal('0.1')*j),2)}}_\)

content.text:
If the average speed of a car is _{j}_ km/hour.
Find the revolution made by each wheel of the car in _{k}_hours
(Diameter of the wheel=_{{Decimal('0.1')*j}}_metres)
